Dear Manoj: Thank you for your interest for my proposal of the cometary imp=
acts into ocean. My intenton is to=C2=A0 explore a possibility that some en=
ormous comets of the early Earth period period with an appropriate energy/m=
ass could create considerable amounts of free molecular oxygen (O2). This o=
xygen was generated through the thermal dissociation of cometary H2O vapour=
 with subsequent escape of hydrogen into interplanetary space. In my previo=
us report ( Premovi=C4=87, P.I. (2003) Cometary impacts into ocean: Thermoc=
hemical equilibrium calculations of high-temperature O2 generation on the e=
arly Earth. International Journal of Impact Engineering 29, 575-587.)=C2=A0=

=C2=A0I performed thermochemical equilibrium calculations at different tem=
peratures (from 1500 K up to 6000 K) and different pressures (from 1 mbar u=
p to 270 bar) using the Gibbs-free-energy- minimization method (the STANJAN=
 method) and JANAF thermochemical tables (the Chemkin collections=C3=A2). T=
hen, I simply extrapolate my conclusions for temperatures higher than 6000 =
K but I was not happy with this.=C2=A0I wish now with someone=C2=A0to make =
thermochemical calculations for temperatures =C2=A0higher=C2=A0up to 20,000=
 K, if it is possible at all.=C2=A0
At the moment I am on vacation in Greec=
e so I am not able to send to you a copy of this report. On the end of July=
 I will be back in my Lab and I would you send this copy.
Looking for your =
reply.
Best regards,
Pavle=C2=A0=C2=A0

Pavle I. Premovic
Laboratory for Ge=
ochemistry,Cosmochemistry&Astrochemistry
University of Nis, P. O. Box 91,
1=
8000 Nis, Serbia

>
> Dear colleagues: I am a geochemist who h=
as been working for last several years on the thermochemisty of cometary im=
pacts into ocean. I published even a paper related to this subject in respe=
cted Journal of the Impact Engineering. Theoretical calculations in this re=
port was carried out using the Chemkin Collections=C2=AE and the STANJAN me=
thod equilibrium calculations. I wish now to improve these calculations. I =
wonder if someone in the Cantera Yahoo groups is interested to work with me=
 (as a coauthor) on this project.
> Pavle I. Premovic
>
dear pavle
let me k=
now what you want to do using cantera
manoj
